title: Rebel with a Cause
description: Autobiography of Franklin Graham tells of growing up as the son of the best-known evangelist in the world, running away from what others expected of him, and details his involvement in relief work and evangelism during Desert Storm and in war-torn Rwanda, Croatia, and Nicaragua.

title: The Life of Wesley; and the Rise and Progress of Methodism
Select Letters, chiefly on personal religion, by the Rev. J. W. With a sketch of his character, by the Rev. S. Bradburn. [With a preface by T. Jackson.]
George Whitefield and the Great Awakening
description: A biography of a clergyman who with John and Charles Wesley founded the Methodist Church.

title: Life of the Rev. John Wesley
The Oxford Methodist; Or, The Early Life of John Wesley ...
The burning heart: John Wesley, evangelist
The Radical Wesley and Patterns for Church Renewal
The Life of the Rev. John Wesley, A.M.
Giovanni Wesley, sua vita e sua opera
John Wesley as Seen by Contemporaries and Biographers
Heart Set Free
description: Charles Wesley is well known as the sweet singer of Methodism the most gifted and most prolific of all English hymnwriters. His hymns are an exhilarating expression of the evangelical faith and mood of the revival of the eighteenth century. His gift of expressing prayer and praise in great simplicity, and faithfully recording the ups and downs of the Christian life, has enriched and encouraged the whole church. It is, however, a popular misconception that Charles was the hymnwriter and his brother John the preacher. In this new biography Arnold Dallimore firmly establishes Charles as much more than just a poet and puts him in his rightful place in Methodisms history, as one of the most powerful of the open-air field preachers of the revival and an indefatigable evangelist who spoke in demonstration of the Spirit and of power.

title: From the Prize Ring to the Pulpit
All for Christ, Christ for All
Religion, Pluralism, and Democracy Among Germans in the Shenandoah Valley, 1700-1850
description: Discusses the Evangelical movement and its consequences among various German religious groups in the Shenandoah Valley. Describes the discussions that took place concerning such issues as pluralism, democracy, salvation and the position of churches towards slavery. Many leading local pastors and ministers are mentioned.

title: A Look at Various Healing Evangelists and Their Ministries Between the Years 1947 and 1965

The Works of The Reverend George Whitefield, Late of Pembroke College,Oxford and Chaplain to the Rt.Hon.The Countess of Huntingdon, Containing All His Sermons and Tracts which Have Been Already Published, with a Select Collection of Letters Written to His Most Intimate Friends, and Persons of Distinction in England, Scotland, Ireland and America, from the Year 1734 to 1770, Including the Whole Period of His Ministry
Moody
description: This is a lively biography of the most influential evangelist of the last century, D. L. Moody, who traveled perhaps a million miles during his life preaching to more than one hundred million people.

title: Anecdotes of the Rev. George Whitefield
Matthew Wood Green
description: Biographical information on Matthew Wood Green, an evangelist who established a church in North Melbourne.

title: George Whitefield - the Awakener: a Modern Study of the Evangelical Revival, Etc. [With Plates, Including Portraits.].
